data.text: @TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb My mom, Gloria Pitzer, wrote in her journals every day. That & crocheting was her therapy from her hectic life. Journalling helped her a little bit with Dementia in her last year's.
@DeLo2 @TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb Thank you very much! "I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me"!
@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb I think that this group is a hit love them together

@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb I was introduced to Journaling in high school. I found it therapeutic but stopped due to being so busy with 2 kids. You know what...Im starting back real soon. Life has been overwhelming lately!
@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb This was a interesting topic! I actually journal, but my entries are prayers. This has been extremely therapeutic and helps me sleep at night! You guys rock!
@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb I'm enjoying the calmer, less frenetic pace of the third hour...don't screw with it too much.

@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb Congrats on your new gig Craig Melvin! I just watched you on MSNBC (oops) & heard the tribute to your brother! I was also diagnosed at the age of 39 with stage 4 colon cancer & I'm so blessed to be 17 years cancer free that I try to celebrate my birthday everyday!
@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb back to watching the 9 am hour ... thank you
@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb .... As excited as he was to be on his own,he spent the first night reading it. Then called me to say thank you.

@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb One of the best things I’ve done, keeping a journal for my son. It started with an entry in his baby book”recalling the first year”. It has entries after Diana died & after 9/11, which he took to school yrs later to share with his class. I gave it to him when he left for college

@TODAYshow @craigmelvin @hodakotb Journaling is incredible and there is something called eJournaling. Our mission is to help people connect authentically with those who matter most to them. Imagine sharing your journal with those few truly important people in your life? Connection is a 2-way street. :)
